description: SOLITON VACUUM TEST: Non-linear domain structure hypothesis. Tests if CMB peaks arise from vacuum lattice geometry (Q-balls at cosmic scale) rather than acoustic oscillations. FREE fit of r_domain to test if 147 Mpc emerges from data.

parameters.name: r_domain
parameters.description: CRITICAL TEST: Characteristic size of vacuum soliton domains. Analogous to nuclear radius L₀ ~ 1 fm. If optimizer finds ~147 Mpc, domain hypothesis supported. If not, reveals true vacuum scale.

parameters.name: beta_wall
parameters.description: Domain wall sharpness from non-linear potential V(ρ) = β ρ⁴. Higher values → sharper peaks (stronger non-linearity). Links to Lean 4 stability criterion.

parameters.name: A_norm
parameters.description: Overall amplitude normalization. Converts form factor to physical units (μK²). Unlike linear model, soliton form factor has natural O(1) amplitude, so A_norm should be small.

parameters.name: D_M
parameters.description: Comoving distance to last scattering surface (z ≈ 1090). Fixed from standard cosmology. Sets k = ℓ/D_M relation.
